text: Welcome to Exploring Computing.

Today's video is Creating
Webpages, Adding Images.

So, this is going to be part
of a continuing series where

pages.

Previously, we saw how to create
links between our web pages,
and that's certainly critical.

Because as we've
talked about, the thing

that really makes the web,
the web, is that hypertext.

And so, if you've
watched those videos,
you now know how to do that.

But while those links are

pages have on them
is text, that's

going to talk about how
to add images to our web pages.

page.

a standalone tag.
There's no start and end tag.

And it can be a relative
or an absolute reference.

means that this

to have an alt tag.

Alt tag is information

of different purposes,

not be able to see your web

screen readers, which

It turns out that

properties related to what
are called box properties.

Box properties allow me to
put boxes around elements.

And so, the box properties
are the margin, the border,

These work not only on
images, but on any block level
elements.

So, if you want to put a

around a paragraph, you

And in fact, this can give
